column5: We were skunked on the walleye last night, so we switched to rock bass fishing and ended the night with 14lbs 4oz of the tastey spring rockies.
yummy!  good fighting fish for their size and even better tasting. Nicely done!
Nice job!  I have to say, Rock Bass maybe my favourite tasting fish.
which area did you go to?
How do the world's greatest sport fish taste compared to other fish?  More like walleye/perch, or closer to bass?  This may come handy when I get skunked on walleye opener next week.
Sarnia Bay was the Location (PM me for details).  And I think they taste like a cross between bluegill and crappie.
Never tried them, don't know why, they probably taste good and hardly anyone keeps them, nice haul.
I find they are flaky like bass and tasty out of cold water.  I also find they hit anything but give up quick.

Caught a good one once while perch fishing, kept it and it went into the pan. Tasted OK. I figured why not try it? It's another panfish of a different colour that's all.  BTW, are you managing to keep the neighbourhood cat's, 'coons and skunks away from your patio with the lingering scent of fish on it?
nothin like a feed of rockers to start the season
I've got a 120lb Yellow Lab who does it for me.
I bet Rich is getting excited seeing those pics.  The Rock Bass King!
When we were kids camping we ate them all the time.Stringer of them along with a few smallies and a walleye or two.It,s all good.

I thought all Bass were flakes!   Cold water Rocketino's can be very good, if you can ever get the stench they give off, off of your hands! Been a long time since I ate one though... hmmmm... may not starve to death after all! HH

The trick I use (for all fish) is rub your hands on stainless steel while the water is running.  Cabelas (and others) sell a stainless steel bar of soap that does the same thing.  Not sure the scientific process, but it works.
Those bars work great,even for getting the smell of gasoline off yer hands,or the scent of the mistress.
When I get home, I rub my hands on the stainless steel sink while washing...I'm just too cheap to go buy the bar....LOL.
Me to Cliff!  I believe it is also good for removing the smell of garlic from your hands. My wife thinks I have a thing for the kitchen faucet! Apparently, I'm rubbing it the wrong way! HH
ok this is going in a direction that disturbs me...lol
LOL....(looking to the topic title....Rock Bass)....I think we are little off topic.  HH...I wash my hands and leave...no playing around at the sink for me....LOL.
What do you know, you learn a new thing every day.  I gotta give this sink thing a try.
Yah, yah... Rock Bass... that's the ticket! HH
I had no idea the world's greatest sport fish (WGSF) was a tasty treat too.  Mike
